SENT.plain: The in vitro and in vivo growth of lymphoblastoid cell lines (LCLs), Burkitt lymphomas (BLs) and PBL-derived immunoblastomas in SCID mice was studied in parallel
Most, but not all, of the LCLs tested were tumorigenic in SCID mice
Long-term culturing in vitro was not a necessary prerequisite for tumorigenicity
There was a good correlation between in vivo and in vitro growth
Three major classes of cells could be distinguished on the basis of their growth properties
